summary.long: Leviticus is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The Lord called to Moses from the Tabernacle and said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel. When you present an animal as an offering to the Lord, you may take it from your herd of cattle or your flock of sheep and goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the animal you present as a burnt offering is from the herd, it must be a male with no defects. Bring it to the entrance of the Tabernacle so you may be accepted by the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay your hand on the animal’s head, and the Lord will accept its death in your place to purify you, making you right with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then slaughter the young bull in the Lord’s presence, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, will present the animal’s blood by splattering it against all sides of the altar that stands at the entrance to the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then skin the animal and cut it into pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron the priest will build a wood fire on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will arrange the pieces of the offering, including the head and fat, on the wood burning on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the internal organs and the legs must first be washed with water. Then the priest will burn the entire sacrifice on the altar as a burnt offering. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the animal you present as a burnt offering is from the flock, it may be either a sheep or a goat, but it must be a male with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slaughter the animal on the north side of the altar in the Lord’s presence, and Aaron’s sons, the priests, will splatter its blood against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then cut the animal in pieces, and the priests will arrange the pieces of the offering, including the head and fat, on the wood burning on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the internal organs and the legs must first be washed with water. Then the priest will burn the entire sacrifice on the altar as a burnt offering. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you present a bird as a burnt offering to the Lord, choose either a turtledove or a young pigeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take the bird to the altar, wring off its head, and burn it on the altar. But first he must drain its blood against the side of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must also remove the crop and the feathers and throw them in the ashes on the east side of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, grasping the bird by its wings, the priest will tear the bird open, but without tearing it apart. Then he will burn it as a burnt offering on the wood burning on the altar. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you present grain as an offering to the Lord, the offering must consist of choice flour. You are to pour olive oil on it, sprinkle it with frankincense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and bring it to Aaron’s sons, the priests. The priest will scoop out a handful of the flour moistened with oil, together with all the frankincense, and burn this representative portion on the altar. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the grain offering will then be given to Aaron and his sons. This offering will be considered a most holy part of the special gifts presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If your offering is a grain offering baked in an oven, it must be made of choice flour, but without any yeast. It may be presented in the form of thin cakes mixed with olive oil or wafers spread with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your grain offering is cooked on a griddle, it must be made of choice flour mixed with olive oil but without any yeast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Break it in pieces and pour olive oil on it; it is a grain offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your grain offering is prepared in a pan, it must be made of choice flour and olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No matter how a grain offering for the Lord has been prepared, bring it to the priest, who will present it at the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take a representative portion of the grain offering and burn it on the altar. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the grain offering will then be given to Aaron and his sons as their food. This offering will be considered a most holy part of the special gifts presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not use yeast in preparing any of the grain offerings you present to the Lord, because no yeast or honey may be burned as a special gift presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may add yeast and honey to an offering of the first crops of your harvest, but these must never be offered on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Season all your grain offerings with salt to remind you of God’s eternal covenant. Never forget to add salt to your grain offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you present a grain offering to the Lord from the first portion of your harvest, bring fresh grain that is coarsely ground and roasted on a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put olive oil on this grain offering, and sprinkle it with frankincense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take a representative portion of the grain moistened with oil, together with all the frankincense, and burn it as a special gift presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you present an animal from the herd as a peace offering to the Lord, it may be a male or a female, but it must have no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lay your hand on the animal’s head, and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tabernacle. Then Aaron’s sons, the priests, will splatter its blood against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must present part of this peace offering as a special gift to the Lord. This includes all the fat around the internal organs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two kidneys and the fat around them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver. These must be removed with the kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Aaron’s sons will burn them on top of the burnt offering on the wood burning on the altar. It is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you present an animal from the flock as a peace offering to the Lord, it may be a male or a female, but it must have no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you present a sheep as your offering, bring it to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lay your hand on its head, and slaughter it in front of the Tabernacle. Aaron’s sons will then splatter the sheep’s blood against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must present the fat of this peace offering as a special gift to the Lord. This includes the fat of the broad tail cut off near the backbone, all the fat around the internal organs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two kidneys and the fat around them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver. These must be removed with the kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest will burn them on the altar. It is a special gift of food presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you present a goat as your offering, bring it to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lay your hand on its head, and slaughter it in front of the Tabernacle. Aaron’s sons will then splatter the goat’s blood against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must present part of this offering as a special gift to the Lord. This includes all the fat around the internal organs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two kidneys and the fat around them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver. These must be removed with the kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priest will burn them on the altar. It is a special gift of food, a pleasing aroma to the Lord. All the fat belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must never eat any fat or blood. This is a permanent law for you, and it must be observed from generation to generation, wherever you live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel. This is how you are to deal with those who sin unintentionally by doing anything that violates one of the Lord’s commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the high priest sins, bringing guilt upon the entire community, he must give a sin offering for the sin he has committed. He must present to the Lord a young bull with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must bring the bull to the Lord at the entrance of the Tabernacle, lay his hand on the bull’s head, and slaughter it before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest will then take some of the bull’s blood into the Tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before the Lord in front of the inner curtain of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then put some of the blood on the horns of the altar for fragrant incense that stands in the Lord’s presence inside the Tabernacle. He will pour out the rest of the bull’s blood at the base of the altar for burnt offerings at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest must remove all the fat of the bull to be offered as a sin offering. This includes all the fat around the internal organs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two kidneys and the fat around them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver. He must remove these along with the kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as he does with cattle offered as a peace offering, and burn them on the altar of burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he must take whatever is left of the bull—its hide, meat, head, legs, internal organs, and dung—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and carry it away to a place outside the camp that is ceremonially clean, the place where the ashes are dumped. There, on the ash heap, he will burn it on a wood fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the entire Israelite community sins by violating one of the Lord’s commands, but the people don’t realize it, they are still guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they become aware of their sin, the people must bring a young bull as an offering for their sin and present it before the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of the community must then lay their hands on the bull’s head and slaughter it before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest will then take some of the bull’s blood into the Tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before the Lord in front of the inner curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will then put some of the blood on the horns of the altar for fragrant incense that stands in the Lord’s presence inside the Tabernacle. He will pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar for burnt offerings at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest must remove all the animal’s fat and burn it on the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as he does with the bull offered as a sin offering for the high priest. Through this process, the priest will purify the people, making them right with the Lord, and they will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest must take what is left of the bull and carry it outside the camp and burn it there, just as is done with the sin offering for the high priest. This offering is for the sin of the entire congregation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one of Israel’s leaders sins by violating one of the commands of the Lord his God but doesn’t realize it, he is still guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he becomes aware of his sin, he must bring as his offering a male goat with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must lay his hand on the goat’s head and slaughter it at the place where burnt offerings are slaughtered before the Lord. This is an offering for his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will dip his finger in the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. He will pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he must burn all the goat’s fat on the altar, just as he does with the peace offering. Through this process, the priest will purify the leader from his sin, making him right with the Lord, and he will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If any of the common people sin by violating one of the Lord’s commands, but they don’t realize it, they are still guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they become aware of their sin, they must bring as an offering for their sin a female goat with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must lay a hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it at the place where burnt offerings are slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will dip his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. He will pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he must remove all the goat’s fat, just as he does with the fat of the peace offering. He will burn the fat on the altar, and it will be a pleasing aroma to the Lord. Through this process, the priest will purify the people, making them right with the Lord, and they will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the people bring a sheep as their sin offering, it must be a female with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must lay a hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it at the place where burnt offerings are slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will dip his finger in the blood of the sin offering and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. He will pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he must remove all the sheep’s fat, just as he does with the fat of a sheep presented as a peace offering. He will burn the fat on the altar on top of the special gifts presented to the Lord. Through this process, the priest will purify the people from their sin, making them right with the Lord, and they will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you are called to testify about something you have seen or that you know about, it is sinful to refuse to testify, and you will be punished for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose you unknowingly touch something that is ceremonially unclean, such as the carcass of an unclean animal. When you realize what you have done, you must admit your defilement and your guilt. This is true whether it is a wild animal, a domestic animal, or an animal that scurries along the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose you unknowingly touch something that makes a person unclean. When you realize what you have done, you must admit your guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Or suppose you make a foolish vow of any kind, whether its purpose is for good or for bad. When you realize its foolishness, you must admit your guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you become aware of your guilt in any of these ways, you must confess your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you must bring to the Lord as the penalty for your sin a female from the flock, either a sheep or a goat. This is a sin offering with which the priest will purify you from your sin, making you right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you cannot afford to bring a sheep, you may bring to the Lord two turtledoves or two young pigeons as the penalty for your sin. One of the birds will be for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must bring them to the priest, who will present the first bird as the sin offering. He will wring its neck but without severing its head from the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he will sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering against the sides of the altar, and the rest of the blood will be drained out at the base of the altar. This is an offering for sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then prepare the second bird as a burnt offering, following all the procedures that have been prescribed. Through this process the priest will purify you from your sin, making you right with the Lord, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you cannot afford to bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons, you may bring two quarts of choice flour for your sin offering. Since it is an offering for sin, you must not moisten it with olive oil or put any frankincense on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the flour to the priest, who will scoop out a handful as a representative portion. He will burn it on the altar on top of the special gifts presented to the Lord. It is an offering for sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through this process, the priest will purify those who are guilty of any of these sins, making them right with the Lord, and they will be forgiven. The rest of the flour will belong to the priest, just as with the grain offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one of you commits a sin by unintentionally defiling the Lord’s sacred property, you must bring a guilt offering to the Lord. The offering must be your own ram with no defects, or you may buy one of equal value with silver, as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must make restitution for the sacred property you have harmed by paying for the loss, plus an additional 20 percent. When you give the payment to the priest, he will purify you with the ram sacrificed as a guilt offering, making you right with the Lord, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose you sin by violating one of the Lord’s commands. Even if you are unaware of what you have done, you are guilty and will be punished for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a guilt offering, you must bring to the priest your own ram with no defects, or you may buy one of equal value. Through this process the priest will purify you from your unintentional sin, making you right with the Lord, and you will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a guilt offering, for you have been guilty of an offense against the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Suppose one of you sins against your associate and is unfaithful to the Lord. Suppose you cheat in a deal involving a security deposit, or you steal or commit fraud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or you find lost property and lie about it, or you lie while swearing to tell the truth, or you commit any other such sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have sinned in any of these ways, you are guilty. You must give back whatever you stole, or the money you took by extortion, or the security deposit, or the lost property you found,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or anything obtained by swearing falsely. You must make restitution by paying the full price plus an additional 20 percent to the person you have harmed. On the same day you must present a guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a guilt offering to the Lord, you must bring to the priest your own ram with no defects, or you may buy one of equal value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through this process, the priest will purify you before the Lord, making you right with him, and you will be forgiven for any of these sins you have committed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give Aaron and his sons the following instructions regarding the burnt offering. The burnt offering must be left on top of the altar until the next morning, and the fire on the altar must be kept burning all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, after the priest on duty has put on his official linen clothing and linen undergarments, he must clean out the ashes of the burnt offering and put them beside the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he must take off these garments, change back into his regular clothes, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a place that is ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the fire on the altar must be kept burning; it must never go out. Each morning the priest will add fresh wood to the fire and arrange the burnt offering on it. He will then burn the fat of the peace offerings on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, the fire must be kept burning on the altar at all times. It must never go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions regarding the grain offering. Aaron’s sons must present this offering to the Lord in front of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest on duty will take from the grain offering a handful of the choice flour moistened with olive oil, together with all the frankincense. He will burn this representative portion on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and his sons may eat the rest of the flour, but it must be baked without yeast and eaten in a sacred place within the courtyard of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember, it must never be prepared with yeast. I have given it to the priests as their share of the special gifts presented to me. Like the sin offering and the guilt offering, it is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any of Aaron’s male descendants may eat from the special gifts presented to the Lord. This is their permanent right from generation to generation. Anyone or anything that touches these offerings will become holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the day Aaron and his sons are anointed, they must present to the Lord the standard grain offering of two quarts of choice flour, half to be offered in the morning and half to be offered in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be carefully mixed with olive oil and cooked on a griddle. Then slice this grain offering and present it as a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In each generation, the high priest who succeeds Aaron must prepare this same offering. It belongs to the Lord and must be burned up completely. This is a permanent law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All such grain offerings of a priest must be burned up entirely. None of it may be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give Aaron and his sons the following instructions regarding the sin offering. The animal given as an offering for sin is a most holy offering, and it must be slaughtered in the Lord’s presence at the place where the burnt offerings are slaughtered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest who offers the sacrifice as a sin offering must eat his portion in a sacred place within the courtyard of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone or anything that touches the sacrificial meat will become holy. If any of the sacrificial blood spatters on a person’s clothing, the soiled garment must be washed in a sacred place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a clay pot is used to boil the sacrificial meat, it must then be broken. If a bronze pot is used, it must be scoured and thoroughly rinsed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any male from a priest’s family may eat from this offering; it is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the offering for sin may not be eaten if its blood was brought into the Tabernacle as an offering for purification in the Holy Place. It must be completely burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions for the guilt offering. It is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The animal sacrificed as a guilt offering must be slaughtered at the place where the burnt offerings are slaughtered, and its blood must be splattered against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then offer all its fat on the altar, including the fat of the broad tail, the fat around the internal organs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the two kidneys and the fat around them near the loins, and the long lobe of the liver. These are to be removed with the kidneys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the priests will burn them on the altar as a special gift presented to the Lord. This is the guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any male from a priest’s family may eat the meat. It must be eaten in a sacred place, for it is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The same instructions apply to both the guilt offering and the sin offering. Both belong to the priest who uses them to purify someone, making that person right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the case of the burnt offering, the priest may keep the hide of the sacrificed animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any grain offering that has been baked in an oven, prepared in a pan, or cooked on a griddle belongs to the priest who presents it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All other grain offerings, whether made of dry flour or flour moistened with olive oil, are to be shared equally among all the priests, the descendants of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions regarding the different kinds of peace offerings that may be presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you present your peace offering as an expression of thanksgiving, the usual animal sacrifice must be accompanied by various kinds of bread made without yeast—thin cakes mixed with olive oil, wafers spread with oil, and cakes made of choice flour mixed with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This peace offering of thanksgiving must also be accompanied by loaves of bread made with yeast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of each kind of bread must be presented as a gift to the Lord. It will then belong to the priest who splatters the blood of the peace offering against the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The meat of the peace offering of thanksgiving must be eaten on the same day it is offered. None of it may be saved for the next morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you bring an offering to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary offering, the meat must be eaten on the same day the sacrifice is offered, but whatever is left over may be eaten on the second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any meat left over until the third day must be completely burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the meat from the peace offering is eaten on the third day, the person who presented it will not be accepted by the Lord. You will receive no credit for offering it. By then the meat will be contaminated; if you eat it, you will be punished for your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Meat that touches anything ceremonially unclean may not be eaten; it must be completely burned up. The rest of the meat may be eaten, but only by people who are ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you are ceremonially unclean and you eat meat from a peace offering that was presented to the Lord, you will be cut off from the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you touch anything that is unclean (whether it is human defilement or an unclean animal or any other unclean, detestable thing) and then eat meat from a peace offering presented to the Lord, you will be cut off from the community.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel. You must never eat fat, whether from cattle, sheep, or goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fat of an animal found dead or torn to pieces by wild animals must never be eaten, though it may be used for any other purpose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who eats fat from an animal presented as a special gift to the Lord will be cut off from the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No matter where you live, you must never consume the blood of any bird or animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who consumes blood will be cut off from the community.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel. When you present a peace offering to the Lord, bring part of it as a gift to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Present it to the Lord with your own hands as a special gift to the Lord. Bring the fat of the animal, together with the breast, and lift up the breast as a special offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will burn the fat on the altar, but the breast will belong to Aaron and his descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give the right thigh of your peace offering to the priest as a gift.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The right thigh must always be given to the priest who offers the blood and the fat of the peace offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have reserved the breast of the special offering and the right thigh of the sacred offering for the priests. It is the permanent right of Aaron and his descendants to share in the peace offerings brought by the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is their rightful share. The special gifts presented to the Lord have been reserved for Aaron and his descendants from the time they were set apart to serve the Lord as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day they were anointed, the Lord commanded the Israelites to give these portions to the priests as their permanent share from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the instructions for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering, as well as the ordination offering and the peace offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave these instructions to Moses on Mount Sinai when he commanded the Israelites to present their offerings to the Lord in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring Aaron and his sons, along with their sacred garments, the anointing oil, the bull for the sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of bread made without yeast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and call the entire community of Israel together at the entrance of the Tabernacle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses followed the Lord’s instructions, and the whole community assembled at the Tabernacle entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses announced to them, “This is what the Lord has commanded us to do!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he presented Aaron and his sons and washed them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the official tunic on Aaron and tied the sash around his waist. He dressed him in the robe, placed the ephod on him, and attached the ephod securely with its decorative sash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses placed the chestpiece on Aaron and put the Urim and the Thummim inside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed the turban on Aaron’s head and attached the gold medallion—the badge of holiness—to the front of the turban, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle and everything in it, making them holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sprinkled the oil on the altar seven times, anointing it and all its utensils, as well as the washbasin and its stand, making them holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head, anointing him and making him holy for his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Moses presented Aaron’s sons. He clothed them in their tunics, tied their sashes around them, and put their special head coverings on them, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses presented the bull for the sin offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the bull’s head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses slaughtered it. Moses took some of the blood, and with his finger he put it on the four horns of the altar to purify it. He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar. Through this process, he made the altar holy by purifying it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took all the fat around the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat around them, and he burned it all on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the rest of the bull, including its hide, meat, and dung, and burned it on a fire outside the camp, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses presented the ram for the burnt offering. Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the ram’s head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses slaughtered it. Then Moses took the ram’s blood and splattered it against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he cut the ram into pieces, and he burned the head, some of its pieces, and the fat on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After washing the internal organs and the legs with water, Moses burned the entire ram on the altar as a burnt offering. It was a pleasing aroma, a special gift presented to the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses presented the other ram, which was the ram of ordination. Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the ram’s head,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses slaughtered it. Then Moses took some of its blood and applied it to the lobe of Aaron’s right ear, the thumb of his right hand, and the big toe of his right foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Moses presented Aaron’s sons and applied some of the blood to the lobes of their right ears, the thumbs of their right hands, and the big toes of their right feet. He then splattered the rest of the blood against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Moses took the fat, including the fat of the broad tail, the fat around the internal organs, the long lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat around them, along with the right thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On top of these he placed a thin cake of bread made without yeast, a cake of bread mixed with olive oil, and a wafer spread with olive oil. All these were taken from the basket of bread made without yeast that was placed in the Lord’s presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons, and he lifted these gifts as a special offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses then took all the offerings back from them and burned them on the altar on top of the burnt offering. This was the ordination offering. It was a pleasing aroma, a special gift presented to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took the breast and lifted it up as a special offering to the Lord. This was Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination, just as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar, and he sprinkled them on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments. In this way, he made Aaron and his sons and their garments holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons, “Boil the remaining meat of the offerings at the Tabernacle entrance, and eat it there, along with the bread that is in the basket of offerings for the ordination, just as I commanded when I said, ‘Aaron and his sons will eat it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any meat or bread that is left over must then be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not leave the Tabernacle entrance for seven days, for that is when the ordination ceremony will be completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything we have done today was commanded by the Lord in order to purify you, making you right with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now stay at the entrance of the Tabernacle day and night for seven days, and do everything the Lord requires. If you fail to do this, you will die, for this is what the Lord has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron and his sons did everything the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the ordination ceremony, on the eighth day, Moses called together Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Aaron, “Take a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both without defects, and present them to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then tell the Israelites, ‘Take a male goat for a sin offering, and take a calf and a lamb, both a year old and without defects, for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also take a bull and a ram for a peace offering and flour moistened with olive oil for a grain offering. Present all these offerings to the Lord because the Lord will appear to you today.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people presented all these things at the entrance of the Tabernacle, just as Moses had commanded. Then the whole community came forward and stood before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, “This is what the Lord has commanded you to do so that the glory of the Lord may appear to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Come to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering to purify yourself and the people. Then present the offerings of the people to purify them, making them right with the Lord, just as he has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron went to the altar and slaughtered the calf as a sin offering for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons brought him the blood, and he dipped his finger in it and put it on the horns of the altar. He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he burned on the altar the fat, the kidneys, and the long lobe of the liver from the sin offering, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The meat and the hide, however, he burned outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Aaron slaughtered the animal for the burnt offering. His sons brought him the blood, and he splattered it against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they handed him each piece of the burnt offering, including the head, and he burned them on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he washed the internal organs and the legs and burned them on the altar along with the rest of the burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next Aaron presented the offerings of the people. He slaughtered the people’s goat and presented it as an offering for their sin, just as he had first done with the offering for his own sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he presented the burnt offering and sacrificed it in the prescribed way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also presented the grain offering, burning a handful of the flour mixture on the altar, in addition to the regular burnt offering for the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron slaughtered the bull and the ram for the people’s peace offering. His sons brought him the blood, and he splattered it against all sides of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the fat of the bull and the ram—the fat of the broad tail and from around the internal organs—along with the kidneys and the long lobes of the livers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed these fat portions on top of the breasts of these animals and burned them on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron then lifted up the breasts and right thighs as a special offering to the Lord, just as Moses had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, Aaron raised his hands toward the people and blessed them. Then, after presenting the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offering, he stepped down from the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went into the Tabernacle, and when they came back out, they blessed the people again, and the glory of the Lord appeared to the whole community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fire blazed forth from the Lord’s presence and consumed the burnt offering and the fat on the altar. When the people saw this, they shouted with joy and fell face down on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu put coals of fire in their incense burners and sprinkled incense over them. In this way, they disobeyed the Lord by burning before him the wrong kind of fire, different than he had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So fire blazed forth from the Lord’s presence and burned them up, and they died there before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord meant when he said,
‘I will display my holiness
    through those who come near me.
I will display my glory
    before all the people.’”
And Aaron was silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses called for Mishael and Elzaphan, Aaron’s cousins, the sons of Aaron’s uncle Uzziel. He said to them, “Come forward and carry away the bodies of your relatives from in front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came forward and picked them up by their garments and carried them out of the camp, just as Moses had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not show grief by leaving your hair uncombed or by tearing your clothes. If you do, you will die, and the Lord’s anger will strike the whole community of Israel. However, the rest of the Israelites, your relatives, may mourn because of the Lord’s fiery destruction of Nadab and Abihu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must not leave the entrance of the Tabernacle or you will die, for you have been anointed with the Lord’s anointing oil.” So they did as Moses commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You and your descendants must never drink wine or any other alcoholic drink before going into the Tabernacle. If you do, you will die. This is a permanent law for you, and it must be observed from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must distinguish between what is sacred and what is common, between what is ceremonially unclean and what is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must teach the Israelites all the decrees that the Lord has given them through Moses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar, “Take what is left of the grain offering after a portion has been presented as a special gift to the Lord, and eat it beside the altar. Make sure it contains no yeast, for it is most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must eat it in a sacred place, for it has been given to you and your descendants as your portion of the special gifts presented to the Lord. These are the commands I have been given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the breast and thigh that were lifted up as a special offering may be eaten in any place that is ceremonially clean. These parts have been given to you and your descendants as your portion of the peace offerings presented by the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must lift up the thigh and breast as a special offering to the Lord, along with the fat of the special gifts. These parts will belong to you and your descendants as your permanent right, just as the Lord has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses then asked them what had happened to the goat of the sin offering. When he discovered it had been burned up, he became very angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why didn’t you eat the sin offering in the sacred area?” he demanded. “It is a holy offering! The Lord has given it to you to remove the guilt of the community and to purify the people, making them right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the animal’s blood was not brought into the Holy Place, you should have eaten the meat in the sacred area as I ordered you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron answered Moses, “Today my sons presented both their sin offering and their burnt offering to the Lord. And yet this tragedy has happened to me. If I had eaten the people’s sin offering on such a tragic day as this, would the Lord have been pleased?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses heard this, he was satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give the following instructions to the people of Israel.
“Of all the land animals, these are the ones you may use for food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat any animal that has completely split hooves and chews the cud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not, however, eat the following animals that have split hooves or that chew the cud, but not both. The camel chews the cud but does not have split hooves, so it is ceremonially unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hyrax chews the cud but does not have split hooves, so it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hare chews the cud but does not have split hooves, so it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pig has evenly split hooves but does not chew the cud, so it is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may not eat the meat of these animals or even touch their carcasses. They are ceremonially unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of all the marine animals, these are ones you may use for food. You may eat anything from the water if it has both fins and scales, whether taken from salt water or from streams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must never eat animals from the sea or from rivers that do not have both fins and scales. They are detestable to you. This applies both to little creatures that live in shallow water and to all creatures that live in deep water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will always be detestable to you. You must never eat their meat or even touch their dead bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any marine animal that does not have both fins and scales is detestable to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the birds that are detestable to you. You must never eat them: the griffon vulture, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the kite, falcons of all kinds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ravens of all kinds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eagle owl, the short-eared owl, the seagull, hawks of all kinds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the barn owl, the desert owl, the Egyptian vulture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the stork, herons of all kinds, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must not eat winged insects that walk along the ground; they are detestable to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may, however, eat winged insects that walk along the ground and have jointed legs so they can jump.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The insects you are permitted to eat include all kinds of locusts, bald locusts, crickets, and grasshoppers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All other winged insects that walk along the ground are detestable to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The following creatures will make you ceremonially unclean. If any of you touch their carcasses, you will be defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you pick up their carcasses, you must wash your clothes, and you will remain defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any animal that has split hooves that are not evenly divided or that does not chew the cud is unclean for you. If you touch the carcass of such an animal, you will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the animals that walk on all fours, those that have paws are unclean. If you touch the carcass of such an animal, you will be defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you pick up its carcass, you must wash your clothes, and you will remain defiled until evening. These animals are unclean for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of the small animals that scurry along the ground, these are unclean for you: the mole rat, the rat, large lizards of all kinds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the common lizard, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these small animals are unclean for you. If any of you touch the dead body of such an animal, you will be defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If such an animal dies and falls on something, that object will be unclean. This is true whether the object is made of wood, cloth, leather, or burlap. Whatever its use, you must dip it in water, and it will remain defiled until evening. After that, it will be ceremonially clean and may be used again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If such an animal falls into a clay pot, everything in the pot will be defiled, and the pot must be smashed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the water from such a container spills on any food, the food will be defiled. And any beverage in such a container will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any object on which the carcass of such an animal falls will be defiled. If it is an oven or hearth, it must be destroyed, for it is defiled, and you must treat it accordingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, if the carcass of such an animal falls into a spring or a cistern, the water will still be clean. But anyone who touches the carcass will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the carcass falls on seed grain to be planted in the field, the seed will still be considered clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the seed is wet when the carcass falls on it, the seed will be defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If an animal you are permitted to eat dies and you touch its carcass, you will be defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you eat any of its meat or carry away its carcass, you must wash your clothes, and you will remain defiled until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All small animals that scurry along the ground are detestable, and you must never eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This includes all animals that slither along on their bellies, as well as those with four legs and those with many feet. All such animals that scurry along the ground are detestable, and you must never eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not defile yourselves by touching them. You must not make yourselves ceremonially unclean because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am the Lord your God. You must consecrate yourselves and be holy, because I am holy. So do not defile yourselves with any of these small animals that scurry along the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I, the Lord, am the one who brought you up from the land of Egypt, that I might be your God. Therefore, you must be holy because I am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions regarding land animals, birds, marine creatures, and animals that scurry along the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By these instructions you will know what is unclean and clean, and which animals may be eaten and which may not be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel. If a woman becomes pregnant and gives birth to a son, she will be ceremonially unclean for seven days, just as she is unclean during her menstrual period.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day the boy’s foreskin must be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After waiting thirty-three days, she will be purified from the bleeding of childbirth. During this time of purification, she must not touch anything that is set apart as holy. And she must not enter the sanctuary until her time of purification is over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a woman gives birth to a daughter, she will be ceremonially unclean for two weeks, just as she is unclean during her menstrual period. After waiting sixty-six days, she will be purified from the bleeding of childbirth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the time of purification is completed for either a son or a daughter, the woman must bring a one-year-old lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or turtledove for a purification offering. She must bring her offerings to the priest at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then present them to the Lord to purify her. Then she will be ceremonially clean again after her bleeding at childbirth. These are the instructions for a woman after the birth of a son or a daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a woman cannot afford to bring a lamb, she must bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons. One will be for the burnt offering and the other for the purification offering. The priest will sacrifice them to purify her, and she will be ceremonially clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone has a swelling or a rash or discolored skin that might develop into a serious skin disease, that person must be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will examine the affected area of the skin. If the hair in the affected area has turned white and the problem appears to be more than skin-deep, it is a serious skin disease, and the priest who examines it must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the affected area of the skin is only a white discoloration and does not appear to be more than skin-deep, and if the hair on the spot has not turned white, the priest will quarantine the person for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest will make another examination. If he finds the affected area has not changed and the problem has not spread on the skin, the priest will quarantine the person for seven more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest will make another examination. If he finds the affected area has faded and has not spread, the priest will pronounce the person ceremonially clean. It was only a rash. The person’s clothing must be washed, and the person will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the rash continues to spread after the person has been examined by the priest and has been pronounced clean, the infected person must return to be examined again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest finds that the rash has spread, he must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean, for it is indeed a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Anyone who develops a serious skin disease must go to the priest for an examination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest finds a white swelling on the skin, and some hair on the spot has turned white, and there is an open sore in the affected area,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it is a chronic skin disease, and the priest must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean. In such cases the person need not be quarantined, for it is obvious that the skin is defiled by the disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now suppose the disease has spread all over the person’s skin, covering the body from head to foot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest examines the infected person and finds that the disease covers the entire body, he will pronounce the person ceremonially clean. Since the skin has turned completely white, the person is clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any open sores appear, the infected person will be pronounced ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must make this pronouncement as soon as he sees an open sore, since open sores indicate the presence of a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if the open sores heal and turn white like the rest of the skin, the person must return to the priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for another examination. If the affected areas have indeed turned white, the priest will then pronounce the person ceremonially clean by declaring, ‘You are clean!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone has a boil on the skin that has started to heal,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a white swelling or a reddish white spot develops in its place, that person must go to the priest to be examined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest examines it and finds it to be more than skin-deep, and if the hair in the affected area has turned white, the priest must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean. The boil has become a serious skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the priest finds no white hair on the affected area and the problem appears to be no more than skin-deep and has faded, the priest must quarantine the person for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If during that time the affected area spreads on the skin, the priest must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean, because it is a serious disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the area grows no larger and does not spread, it is merely the scar from the boil, and the priest will pronounce the person ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone has suffered a burn on the skin and the burned area changes color, becoming either reddish white or shiny white,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must examine it. If he finds that the hair in the affected area has turned white and the problem appears to be more than skin-deep, a skin disease has broken out in the burn. The priest must then pronounce the person ceremonially unclean, for it is clearly a serious skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the priest finds no white hair on the affected area and the problem appears to be no more than skin-deep and has faded, the priest must quarantine the infected person for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest must examine the person again. If the affected area has spread on the skin, the priest must pronounce that person ceremonially unclean, for it is clearly a serious skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the affected area has not changed or spread on the skin and has faded, it is simply a swelling from the burn. The priest will then pronounce the person ceremonially clean, for it is only the scar from the burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone, either a man or woman, has a sore on the head or chin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must examine it. If he finds it is more than skin-deep and has fine yellow hair on it, the priest must pronounce the person ceremonially unclean. It is a scabby sore of the head or chin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the priest examines the scabby sore and finds that it is only skin-deep but there is no black hair on it, he must quarantine the person for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest must examine the sore again. If he finds that the scabby sore has not spread, and there is no yellow hair on it, and it appears to be only skin-deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the person must shave off all hair except the hair on the affected area. Then the priest must quarantine the person for another seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day he will examine the sore again. If it has not spread and appears to be no more than skin-deep, the priest will pronounce the person ceremonially clean. The person’s clothing must be washed, and the person will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the scabby sore begins to spread after the person is pronounced clean,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must do another examination. If he finds that the sore has spread, the priest does not need to look for yellow hair. The infected person is ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the color of the scabby sore does not change and black hair has grown on it, it has healed. The priest will then pronounce the person ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone, either a man or woman, has shiny white patches on the skin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must examine the affected area. If he finds that the shiny patches are only pale white, this is a harmless skin rash, and the person is ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man loses his hair and his head becomes bald, he is still ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he loses hair on his forehead, he simply has a bald forehead; he is still clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if a reddish white sore appears on the bald area on top of his head or on his forehead, this is a skin disease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must examine him, and if he finds swelling around the reddish white sore anywhere on the man’s head and it looks like a skin disease,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the man is indeed infected with a skin disease and is unclean. The priest must pronounce him ceremonially unclean because of the sore on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Those who suffer from a serious skin disease must tear their clothing and leave their hair uncombed. They must cover their mouth and call out, ‘Unclean! Unclean!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as the serious disease lasts, they will be ceremonially unclean. They must live in isolation in their place outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now suppose mildew contaminates some woolen or linen clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: woolen or linen fabric, the hide of an animal, or anything made of leather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the contaminated area in the clothing, the animal hide, the fabric, or the leather article has turned greenish or reddish, it is contaminated with mildew and must be shown to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After examining the affected spot, the priest will put the article in quarantine for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest must inspect it again. If the contaminated area has spread, the clothing or fabric or leather is clearly contaminated by a serious mildew and is ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest must burn the item—the clothing, the woolen or linen fabric, or piece of leather—for it has been contaminated by a serious mildew. It must be completely destroyed by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the priest examines it and finds that the contaminated area has not spread in the clothing, the fabric, or the leather,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest will order the object to be washed and then quarantined for seven more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest must examine the object again. If he finds that the contaminated area has not changed color after being washed, even if it did not spread, the object is defiled. It must be completely burned up, whether the contaminated spot is on the inside or outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the priest examines it and finds that the contaminated area has faded after being washed, he must cut the spot from the clothing, the fabric, or the leather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the spot later reappears on the clothing, the fabric, or the leather article, the mildew is clearly spreading, and the contaminated object must be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the spot disappears from the clothing, the fabric, or the leather article after it has been washed, it must be washed again; then it will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions for dealing with mildew that contaminates woolen or linen clothing or fabric or anything made of leather. This is how the priest will determine whether these items are ceremonially clean or unclean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The following instructions are for those seeking ceremonial purification from a skin disease. Those who have been healed must be brought to the priest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will examine them at a place outside the camp. If the priest finds that someone has been healed of a serious skin disease,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will perform a purification ceremony, using two live birds that are ceremonially clean, a stick of cedar, some scarlet yarn, and a hyssop branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will order that one bird be slaughtered over a clay pot filled with fresh water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take the live bird, the cedar stick, the scarlet yarn, and the hyssop branch, and dip them into the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then sprinkle the blood of the dead bird seven times on the person being purified of the skin disease. When the priest has purified the person, he will release the live bird in the open field to fly away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The persons being purified must then wash their clothes, shave off all their hair, and bathe themselves in water. Then they will be ceremonially clean and may return to the camp. However, they must remain outside their tents for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day they must again shave all the hair from their heads, including the hair of the beard and eyebrows. They must also wash their clothes and bathe themselves in water. Then they will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the eighth day each person being purified must bring two male lambs and a one-year-old female lamb, all with no defects, along with a grain offering of six quarts of choice flour moistened with olive oil, and a cup of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officiating priest will present that person for purification, along with the offerings, before the Lord at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take one of the male lambs and the olive oil and present them as a guilt offering, lifting them up as a special offering before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will then slaughter the male lamb in the sacred area where sin offerings and burnt offerings are slaughtered. As with the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest. It is a most holy offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then take some of the blood of the guilt offering and apply it to the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the priest will pour some of the olive oil into the palm of his own left hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will dip his right finger into the oil in his palm and sprinkle some of it with his finger seven times before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then apply some of the oil in his palm over the blood from the guilt offering that is on the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will apply the oil remaining in his hand to the head of the person being purified. Through this process, the priest will purify the person before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the priest must present the sin offering to purify the person who was cured of the skin disease. After that, the priest will slaughter the burnt offering
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and offer it on the altar along with the grain offering. Through this process, the priest will purify the person who was healed, and the person will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But anyone who is too poor and cannot afford these offerings may bring one male lamb for a guilt offering, to be lifted up as a special offering for purification. The person must also bring two quarts of choice flour moistened with olive oil for the grain offering and a cup of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The offering must also include two turtledoves or two young pigeons, whichever the person can afford. One of the pair must be used for the sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day of the purification ceremony, the person being purified must bring the offerings to the priest in the Lord’s presence at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will take the lamb for the guilt offering, along with the olive oil, and lift them up as a special offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will slaughter the lamb for the guilt offering. He will take some of its blood and apply it to the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The priest will also pour some of the olive oil into the palm of his own left hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will dip his right finger into the oil in his palm and sprinkle some of it seven times before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then apply some of the oil in his palm over the blood from the guilt offering that is on the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will apply the oil remaining in his hand to the head of the person being purified. Through this process, the priest will purify the person before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the priest will offer the two turtledoves or the two young pigeons, whichever the person can afford.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them is for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering, to be presented along with the grain offering. Through this process, the priest will purify the person before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the instructions for purification for those who have recovered from a serious skin disease but who cannot afford to bring the offerings normally required for the ceremony of purification.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you arrive in Canaan, the land I am giving you as your own possession, I may contaminate some of the houses in your land with mildew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The owner of such a house must then go to the priest and say, ‘It appears that my house has some kind of mildew.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the priest goes in to inspect the house, he must have the house emptied so nothing inside will be pronounced ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will go in and examine the mildew on the walls. If he finds greenish or reddish streaks and the contamination appears to go deeper than the wall’s surface,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest will step outside the door and put the house in quarantine for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day the priest must return for another inspection. If he finds that the mildew on the walls of the house has spread,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must order that the stones from those areas be removed. The contaminated material will then be taken outside the town to an area designated as ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next the inside walls of the entire house must be scraped thoroughly and the scrapings dumped in the unclean place outside the town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other stones will be brought in to replace the ones that were removed, and the walls will be replastered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the mildew reappears after all the stones have been replaced and the house has been scraped and replastered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the priest must return and inspect the house again. If he finds that the mildew has spread, the walls are clearly contaminated with a serious mildew, and the house is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be torn down, and all its stones, timbers, and plaster must be carried out of town to the place designated as ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who enter the house during the period of quarantine will be ceremonially unclean until evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all who sleep or eat in the house must wash their clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the priest returns for his inspection and finds that the mildew has not reappeared in the house after the fresh plastering, he will pronounce it clean because the mildew is clearly gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To purify the house the priest must take two birds, a stick of cedar, some scarlet yarn, and a hyssop branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will slaughter one of the birds over a clay pot filled with fresh water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take the cedar stick, the hyssop branch, the scarlet yarn, and the live bird, and dip them into the blood of the slaughtered bird and into the fresh water. Then he will sprinkle the house seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest has purified the house in exactly this way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he will release the live bird in the open fields outside the town. Through this process, the priest will purify the house, and it will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the instructions for dealing with serious skin diseases, including scabby sores;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and mildew, whether on clothing or in a house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a swelling on the skin, a rash, or discolored skin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This procedure will determine whether a person or object is ceremonially clean or unclean.
“These are the instructions regarding skin diseases and mildew.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give the following instructions to the people of Israel.
“Any man who has a bodily discharge is ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This defilement is caused by his discharge, whether the discharge continues or stops. In either case the man is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any bed on which the man with the discharge lies and anything on which he sits will be ceremonially unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if you touch the man’s bed, you must wash your clothes and bathe yourself in water, and you will remain unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you sit where the man with the discharge has sat, you must wash your clothes and bathe yourself in water, and you will remain unclean until evening.
